config.question: Most of the great planters of the pre–Civil War period were __________.

choices.content: descendants of the old colonial gentry
slave drivers who had earned enough to buy plantations
overseers who had earned enough to buy plantations

answer_3.response: Contrary to legend, most of the great planters of the pre–Civil War period were self-made rather than descendants of the old colonial gentry. Some were ambitious young men who married planters’ daughters. Others started as lawyers and used their fees and connections to acquire plantations.
